page.title: 09Interesting people Class 6
page.content: Interviews were held with five octagenarians of Staining and the following interesting stories were told. The old barn at Baines Farm used to be a weaving shed. The workers wearing clogs walked from Kirkham to work in the clay-built shed. Baby calves are now reared there. Two canonballs found at Baines Farm are thought to be from Oliver Cromwell's Army. They match another one found in St.Chad's Church Poulton. A character known as Black Kirkham rode from Kirkham on a black horse and wearing a black cloak. He used to whip offenders at the whipping post in Poulton, then riding to Fleetwood Court to record his actions. Old remedies included bacon fat around the neck for sore throats, boiled onion in the ear for earache and pepper and brown paper for toothache. Baths were taken only on Fridays.
